pages.text: As one travels the paths of villages and backroads of towns, they might notice strange figures like dancers adorned in the yellowest of robes, often with obscured faces.$(br)These are the $(l:miskatonicmysteries:bestiary/serfs)$(marked)Serfs and Vassals of the Yellow King$().

Protective of the villagers and welcoming to outsiders, these Serfs are often seen devoting themselves to art and protection, and often do not wish to be disturbed. However, those with antlered crowns are willing to help initiate others. Peruse their goods and their Masterpieces, and find yourself set on their path, eventually.

In order to master art, one must first understand and appreciate it. Find fellow enthusiasts and discuss the art. If you donâ€™t forget proper etiquette, they may eventually be willing to $(l:miskatonicmysteries:world/occult_knowledge#hastur_knowledge)$(marked)share their secrets$() in this book.$(br)Use this knowledge to cast the $(marked)Sculptor's Rite$(). Place this book on an $(l:miskatonicmysteries:world/altars)$(marked)Altar$() nearby, pick your material -$(marked)Stone$() or pure $(marked)Terracotta$()- and cast the Rite.
The Rite will be very, $(o)very$() painful, so make sure you do not die.

Give your newly created piece of art to a $(marked)Yellow Vassal$(). They will quickly introduce you, setting your path towards the Yellow King.$(br2)From there on, your ascent is most likely set in stone. You do not have any of the King's powers yet, but soon you will.

pages.obfuscated_text: Hail the prince and kiss his cheek, or else your ascent will look bleak.
pages.text: $(obfs:miskatonicmysteries:hastur;1)The next step is somewhat more elaborate-$(br)In order to receive the first blessing, one must summon a $(l:miskatonicmysteries:bestiary/prince)$(marked)Tattered Prince$(), using the $(l:miskatonicmysteries:rites/golden_coronation)$(marked)Golden Coronation$().$(br)Once summoned, you may let him bless you by talking to him.
